title: 109_hr3885
content: The Act is titled the "District of Columbia and United States Territories Circulating Quarter Dollar Program Act" and involves the issuance of redesigned quarter dollars honoring the District of Columbia and each of the territories. Section 5112 of title 31, United States Code, is amended to include a new subsection for the redesign and issuance of circulating quarter dollars honoring the District of Columbia and the territories in 2009. The coins will have designs emblematic of the District of Columbia and the territories on the reverse side. The Secretary has flexibility in selecting designs for the coins. The redesign and issuance of circulating quarter dollars in 2009 will feature designs emblematic of the District of Columbia and various territories. The coins will have specific inscriptions on the reverse and obverse sides, with each territory represented by a unique design. The Secretary has the authority to select the designs for the coins. The Secretary will select 6 designs for quarter dollars after consulting with relevant officials and the Commission of Fine Arts. The Secretary will review designs for quarter dollars in consultation with the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee, allowing participation from various officials, artists, engravers, and the general public to ensure dignified designs are selected. The Secretary will not choose frivolous or inappropriate designs for quarter dollars minted under this subsection. No head and shoulders portrait or bust of any person, living or dead, and no portrait of a living person can be included in the design. All coins minted under this subsection will be considered numismatic items. The Secretary may mint and issue quarter dollars in uncirculated and proof qualities as determined. The Secretary may mint and issue quarter dollars with 90 percent silver and 10 percent copper, honoring the District of Columbia and territories in 2009 in a specific order. The subsection outlines provisions for the application of the minting of quarter dollars with designs emblematic of territories in the event of statehood or independence. The subsection defines "territory" as specific regions including Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, the US Virgin Islands, and the Northern Mariana Islands. On December 9, 2006, Karen L. Haas attested as Clerk.
